The Authentication API is used to authenticate to the Enviso platform. Integrators will need to use this to be able to access some APIs (for example the Direct Selling API).

* [Documentation: Authentication API](https://help.vintia.com/enviso/developers/authentication-api/en/index-en.html)
* [Repository: Authentication Example Code](https://github.com/gantner-nv/EnvisoApiAuthentication/tree/master)

The Payment API Can be used to initialize web payments using the Enviso Payment Widget (part of our "Ticketing Widget" web components) and verify if the payment was successful. It's also used in some of our other web apps.
* [Documentation: Payment API](https://help.vintia.com/enviso/developers/payment-api/en/index-en.html)

The Reselling API allows you to retrieve venue information as well as reserve and sell tickets of your partner venues on your online selling interface.
* [Documentation: Reselling API](https://help.vintia.com/enviso/developers/reselling-api/en/index-en.html)

The [Ticketing Widget](https://help.vintia.com/enviso/developers/ticketing-widget/en/overview.html) is a collection of drop-in components that can be added to any existing webpage to start selling tickets. This makes it easy for our customers (musea / attraction parcs / etc) to sell tickets on their website.  This is the back-end api for those web components.
See the "Ticketing Widget" domain for more information how this can be configured.

The [Enviso Ticketing Widget](https://help.vintia.com/enviso/developers/ticketing-widget/en/overview.html) is a collection of drop-in Web Components that allows venues to sell tickets on their own website by just placing the component on their webpage. Integrators can implement the components in their webpage with limited technical and functional knowledge of Enviso.

The offers shown on the widget can be configured in the Sales App.

How to configure the ticketing widget:
* [Components](https://widget.staging-enviso.io/demo/demo.html)
* [Documentation: Ticketing Widget](https://help.vintia.com/enviso/developers/ticketing-widget/en/overview.html)
* [Quick-start videos](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLmHxrtM6RmiJHIYPnSjJfBv1BP1G8H4QJ)
* [Example website](https://qaenviso-ticketingwidget.gantner.be/)

> **Important!**
> * Security issues related to the hosting of the widget or a faulty implementation, and not the widget itself, are **out of scope**. If you find issues, they will be accepted but without rewards.
> * Test payment information, card information etc can be found in [the Adyen documentation](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/test-cards/test-card-numbers)
> * Payments are handled by Adyen. We are welcome to accept security issues related to our payment provider but they will not be rewarded (responsibility of the payment provider)!

The Direct selling API allows you to retrieve offers that are published to a specific sales point on the direct sales channel, and sell products related to the offer. This API is mainly used by integrators for selling products through direct sales channels such as cash registers, self-service kiosks or websites.

* [Documentation: Direct Selling API](https://help.vintia.com/enviso/developers/direct-selling-api/en/index-en.html)

This API is used by the Booking App to manage events and timeslots.

The Pricing Center API is used by our different microservices to determine the selling price for tickets.

The Booking App consists out of 2 parts:
1. Enviso Booking for Venues allows you to create events and consult bookings made on your direct channel sales points.
2. The Guide planning app allows you to manage your profile, add your availability and accept/decline guide tasks assigned by your venue partners.

After going to the application, you can immediately choose whether you want to log in as a venue or as a guide. Depending on your choice, you will enter one of the 2 parts of the application

* [Documentation: Booking App](https://help.vintia.com/enviso/help/en/134567-134713-enviso-booking.html)

The Enviso Admin app (previously named Cloud App) allows you to manage users and user roles for Enviso Sales, Enviso Trade, Enviso Booking, Enviso Forms and eLoxx - based on your license for an Enviso app.

Depending on whether you are a venue or a reseller user you can carry out certain functionalities from the Admin app. Some of the activities that are possible on Enviso Admin are configuring languages for data translation, managing licenses and consulting visitor list, sales points and transactions. 

* [Documentation: Admin App](https://help.vintia.com/enviso/help/en/140073-140133-admin.html)

Enviso Sales is a cloud portal that allows you to manage offers, tickets and orders for your direct and indirect channels. You can also manage ticket quantity allocation for the direct and indirect sales channels.

Moreover, it is possible to customise templates for tickets, email and visitor info forms. You can also manage promotional campaigns.

The Sales app also contains an Offer Shop, that allows employees to sell tickets.

Our cloud relay server connection using LsAgent. If the computers you're scanning do not have a direct connection to your Lansweeper installation, scanned LsAgent data can be sent to our relay server in the cloud. 

Our LsAgent is a cross-platform scanning agent that can scan computers both inside and outside of your network. It automatically collects an inventory from the computer it's installed on and sends the data back to the Lansweeper installation, this can be done through our relay server in the cloud.

For this, you must enable relay access in your Lansweeper installation. 
Scanned LsAgent data is sent securely over HTTPS (TLS 1.2) to the relay server in Microsoft Azure, where it is encrypted as well. Your Lansweeper scanning server can retrieve the scanned data from the relay server, after which it is deleted from the relay. In order to use the relay server, make sure outbound traffic is allowed on your Lansweeper scanning server. Specifically, the scanning server must be able to make an outbound connection to port 443 of lsagentrelay.lansweeper.com, the cloud relay server. 

More information about LsAgent can be found on our website: https://community.lansweeper.com/t5/scanning-your-network/introduction-to-lsagent-for-windows-linux-and-mac/ta-p/64473

The use of the relay server must explicitly be enabled in the Lansweeper web console. It is not enabled by default!

This is the primary site for researchers to register and test both the Flywheel App as well as the Flywheel Platform. We will not provide credentials or bypass verification controls (i.e, a researcher will need to either provide a valid phone number or credit card to have a live site), but a researcher may register a demo site that matches the platform's functionality without verification. **Please use your Intigriti credentials to register.** Please note that any issues regarding an individual WordPress installation on the Flywheel platform, outside of plugins owned by WP Engine/Flywheel, will be considered out of scope as we do not monitor or manage customer content. We are, however, very interested in issues that may compromise customer isolation on the platform or cause data to be leaked from either a host or an unrelated customer site.

My Citizen Profile (Mijn Burgerprofiel in Dutch) is the go-to spot for citizens to manage their affairs digitally with the government. Citizens can access their personal data, consult status reports, download certificates, and request new government services such as a permit of subsidy. My Citizen Profile is a plug-in that can be integrated into different official government websites, be it on a Flemish or local level.

Available in Dutch - More information can also be found on https://www.vlaanderen.be/uw-overheid/mijn-burgerprofiel (only in Dutch).

This beta environment is equiped with a mock authentication (OpenID) service, which can generate tokens for different kinds of accounts. As such, the authentication flow of this mocked service is not in scope.

User Management (IDM) is a platform with which you can manage the inflow and outflow of people and their rights to applications.

It is a central rights management for different applications within the entire Flemish administration. It controls the inflow and outflow of employees and their rights and is editable to be tailored to the tasks of each employee.

More information is available on www.vlaanderen.be/gebruikersbeheer. There is detailed product and technical information available for download (in Dutch only).

To be able to test the platform, you will need to create a (dummy) account in our test environment. You can only do this with your intigriti.me e-mail account via a self-registering system available at https://zelfregistratie-gebruikersbeheer-ti.vlaanderen.be/user/aanvraag_werkrelatie?dg=EA&oc=0415928179. You can register with “Kinepolis Group” as a "Hoofd Lokale Beheerder". When you do so, please send an e-mail to veiligheidsbouwstenen@vlaanderen.be with in the subject line "Project Intigriti". We will inform you when the right has been given.

The application is also available in English via this link: https://gebruikersbeheer-ti.vlaanderen.be/webidm/?lang=en.

Some assets under this wildcard is protected by Embark auth.

Embark auth is a critical service at Embark Studios.

It handles authentication for Embark end-users. It's a OAuth2 standard and for authentication it uses third-party login methods (steam, epic, etc). The service has both HTTP and gRPC endpoints available for the players access.

Authentication can either be done by the service triggering an oauth or similar flow for the third party login method or by handing a third party access token and swapping it for a embark access token.

yimg is a resource storage and content distribution network (CDN).
 ## Note: ##  Reports submitted that exploit bugs **only** in the context of the `yimg.com` domain are most likely to be closed as `Informative`.  Most bugs in `*.yimg.com` will require a proof-of-concept or proof-of-exploit that escalates into one of the primary brand or product domains (e.g. yahoo.com or aol.com) to be eligible for bounty. CVSS Environmental scores have been set to account for this limitation.

What does that mean for my report?
1. If you show escalation into a trusted domain's context (such as yahoo.com) it will be accepted at 100% bounty rate. A bonus may be applied for different instances within the trusted domain list only; not for other instances of vulnerabilities content on yimg.com.
2. If you show execution in the context of *.yimg.com only, the vulnerability MAY be accepted by the business owner in some instances. In that case, a minimum bounty would be offered only if the content is removed. There are no "same bug different host" or other vulnerability grouping bonus offers for this asset.
